intro: Esula retusa, commonly known as the smooth esula, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, smooth leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. Esula retusa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
